newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Eight killed in fresh sectarian attack in Pakistan.
newsitem.headline: Eight killed in fresh sectarian attack in Pakistan.

text.p: Gunmen on motorcycles fired on a crowded market in the town of Warbartan in Pakistan's Punjab province on Saturday, killing eight people and wounding 10, witnesses said.
They said the attackers used Kalashnikov assault rifles to spray bullets in the bazaar about 11 a.m. (0700 GMT). Most of the victims were Shi'ite Moslems, they added.
No other details were immediately available about the shooting in Warbartan, about 60 km (37 miles) northwest of the Punjab provincial capital Lahore.
The attack occurred only hours after gunmen killed six Shi'ites at 4 a.m. (2300 GMT Friday), while they slept on the street in the village of Mondka, in the Punjab district of Khangarh.
The dead in the earlier attack included the local head of the Shi'ite Tehrik-i-Jafria Pakistan (TJP) group, identified only as Mushtaq, and several of his relatives, hospital sources said.
Both attacks appeared to be part of a long-running feud between Sunni and Shi'ite militants in populous Punjab province which has cost more than 144 lives this year.
